etymology.description: semantic: 宀(宀) (mián, "roof") + phonetic: 龍(龙) (lóng, "dragon") = protection under a roof granted to a revered creature -> favor; pamper
etymology.interpretation: The character combines the sheltering element 宀(宀) (mián, "roof") with the phonetic and majestic 龍(龙) (lóng, "dragon"), conveying the idea of special attention or privilege granted to someone cherished, like a dragon sheltered in a house.
etymology.simplification: 寵(寵) was simplified to 宠(宠) by reducing 龍(龙) to a more cursive and phonetic form that still resembles the association with protection or favor.

examples.chinese: 妈妈宠孩子(媽媽寵孩子)。
他宠女儿(他寵女兒)，带她去游乐园(帶她去遊樂園)。
examples.pinyin: tā chǒng nǚér, dài tā qù yóulèyuán.
examples.english: He dotes on his daughter and takes her to the amusement park.

examples.chinese: 李先生宠爱宠物(李先生寵愛寵物)。
